levels.title: No bacteria
levels.resultText: This sample has no bacteria colonies.
levels.explanation: Shown when no bacteria was found in the sample.

levels.title: Some bacteria
levels.resultText: This sample contains some bacteria colonies.
levels.explanation: Shown when some bacteria were detected, but still under the limit

levels.title: High bacteria count
levels.resultText: This sample has a high bacteria count.
levels.explanation: Shown when a high bacteria count was detected above the limit.

levels.title: Very high bacteria count
levels.resultText: This sample contains a very high bacteria count.
levels.explanation: Shown when a very high bacteria count was detected, well above the limit.

too_many.title: Too many bacteria
too_many.resultText: This sample contains a very high bacteria, too many to count.
too_many.explanation: Shown when a sample contains a very high bacteria count, too many to count.

overgrown.title: Too many bacteria
overgrown.resultText: This sample contains a very high bacteria, too many to count.
overgrown.explanation: Shown when a sample contains a very high bacteria count, too many to count.

new.title: New sample
new.resultText: This is a fresh sample, which still needs incubation time.
new.explanation: Show when an usually fresh sample still needs incubation time.

anomalous.title: Anomalous sample
anomalous.resultText: This sample looks anomalous. Check the troubleshooting guide for more information.
anomalous.explanation: Shown when the sample looks anomalous. You may check the troubleshooting guide for more information.

unsure.title: Uncertain bacteria count
unsure.resultText: Uncertain bacteria count. Check the troubleshooting guide for more information.
unsure.explanation: Shown when the bacteria count is uncertain. You may check the troubleshooting guide for more information.

chlorine.title: Chlorine level
chlorine.resultText: The free chlorine measurement is shown above.
chlorine.explanation: The recommended value for free chlorine residual in drinking water is 1 mg/L
